page.title: 18PEDDARS WAY -HOUGHTON
page.content: This way or track is thought to have been constucted by the Romans after the Boadiccean revolt during the fist century A.D.It would have conveyed troops and official traffic through Iceni teritory to the Wash ferry and thence to Lincolnshire and the North of England.Certainly, after its constuction there was no further Iceni rebellion.The way is no longer of strategic or political importance; it is now a lonely, fascinating track for walkers, open to the high wide skies in an area known as the Root of Norfolk.It is bounded on both sides by arable land and on Harpley Common there is a group of round barrows. The origins of its name are obscure but the most likely meaning is that of "foot" road.
